title: Gratin dauphinois

ingredients.content: 1200 g potatoes, peeled and cut into round slices (2-3 mm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease a gratin dish (approx 20 x 25 cm) (see tips), set aside.
Place Swiss cheese (optional) into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer cheese into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining ingredients , except cheese, and cook <b>10 min/100°C//speed 1<b>.
Pour mixture into prepared dish and sprinkle with reserved grated cheese (optional). Bake for 20-25 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown on top. Serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: A gratin dish is the traditional French casserole dish, however any rectangular casserole dish can also be used.
This dish is the perfect accompaniment to roasted or grilled meats.
Any hard cheese can be used in place of the Swiss cheese.
Originally from Dauphiné (French Alps) the authentic Gratin dauphinois is made with cream but without the cheese.
Substitute the cream with a mixture of cream and full cream milk.
